results.title: A Man and his dog
results.creator_credit: Supreme Sound Studios and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: An account of the training of Kelpie dogs in the handling of sheep on an Australian sheep station. Explains the possible origin of the breed; shows the special training a dog receives from the time he is a small pup until he can muster and control a mob of a thousand or more sheep; shows the confidence of the dog and the bond of friendship which springs up between the animals and their masters.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Supreme Sound Studios and Australian National Film Board

results.title: A Man and an organ
results.creator_credit: Peter Johnson, Film Australia and John Bushelle
results.brief_description: A filmic insight into Ronald Sharp - the self-taught builder of the Grand Organ in the Sydney Opera House. No Australian building has caught the imagination of the world as much as the Sydney Opera House. Opened in 1973 by Her Majesty, Queen Elizabeth II, it was always intended that the main concert hall of this performing arts miracle building should have as its dominant, centre-stage focus a magnificent organ that would rival the splendour of the instrument in the Sydney Town Hall, the city’s biggest recital organ.

results.title: A Man's hands
results.brief_description: A witty and fast-cut montage dramatising the activities of the human hand: squeezing, poking, fixing, scratching, zipping, playing and touching. Alternatively funny and moving, entertaining and informative.

results.title: A Malecite fancy basket: national Indian arts and crafts
results.creator_credit: B T Film Sound and Geoff Noyce
results.brief_description: Veronica and Jim Atwin, Malecite Indians from the Kingsclear reserve, have been making functional baskets for many years. The film shows how they select and prepare the materials and then make a beautiful fancy basket from black ash and sweetgrass.
results.title_for_label: A Malecite fancy basket: national Indian arts and crafts
results.creator_credit_for_label: B T Film Sound and Geoff Noyce

results.title: A Magic place
results.creator_credit: Linton Briggs, Kathy Whelan, David Briggs and Goulburn Ovens Institute of TAFE
results.brief_description:
Narrated to a background of archival home movie images juxtaposed with contemporary images of Lake Mokoan and the surrounding landscape, local resident Linton Briggs gives his account of the changes which have taken place since the decommissioning of the Lake. He speaks of a magic place, Winton Swamp, where wildlife was in abundance, where a wet-land ecosystem of bird-life, Murray cod, Red-gums, and every variety of duck imaginable used to exist and of his sadness and apprehension the changing of the lake may make to the ecological balance of Lake Mokoan.
Created as part of the “Bute Utes the Movie” project in association with Regional Arts Victoria.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Linton Briggs, Kathy Whelan, David Briggs and Goulburn Ovens Institute of TAFE

results.title: A Loving pinch = Cubit cubitan
results.creator_credit: Sabirin Kasdani, Rapi Films and Maman Firmansjah
results.brief_description: An example of a dangdut musical drama made popular in its time mostly by Indian filmmakers. The dangdut form of music/culture entertainment is a favourite amongst working-class Indonesians, mostly men who traditionally come from a hard day’s work to relax to the music and gyrating hips of the singers. The film features established dangdut star, Elvy Sukaesih, as a mother who comes to Jakarta with her two children to look for her husband, only to find he has eloped with another woman. Separated from her children when the place they are staying for the night catches fire, Elvy becomes a star by sheer luck and is later reunited with her children. While this has been going on her husband has lost his job and is thrown out of his own house by the other woman. Cast includes Elvy Sukaesih, Santi Sardi and Lukman Sardi. In Indonesian with English subtitles.

results.title: A Look outside (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Zero 16 Films, Gibson Film Productions and Dave Gibson
results.brief_description: An optional job experience scheme from 4th form at Nenae College helps students bridge the gap between the classroom and the world outside. Various students are shown gaining experience as a surveyor’s assistant, hairdresser, vet’s assistant and farm worker, working one day a week along side adults in these fields.
